item.title: Virtual Event: Collab Meetup with WWCode Belfast, Contrast Security and InfoSecNI (25th January 2021)
item.dc:creator: ClaireB
item.description:
Hey guys! WWCode were organising an event with Contrast Security, so I’m going to do a brief intro on InfoSecNI; who we are, what we do, and how to reach us. I’m also going to ask if anyone wants to be involved in helping to organise and run events, either online or in person post-covid.

If anyone wants to come along, the meetup is Monday 25th, and you can sign up here: Careers and Staying Current in Cyber Security: An Evening With Contrast Security

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Virtual Event: Collab Meetup with WWCode Belfast, Contrast Security and InfoSecNI (25th January 2021)

item.title: Virtual Event: InfoSecNI Watch-Along Movie Night - “Johnny Mnemonic” @ 7pm 22nd July!
item.dc:creator: bolster
item.description:
Based on William Gibson’s short story first published in 1981, the 1995 film by Robert Longo, follows the titular Johnny, a cybernetic data-courier, who is used to discreetly shuttle information in the real world that’s too sensitive for the VR based Internet of 2021. Seeking to regain his broken memories, Johnny undertakes ‘one more job’ to cover the costs of removal. After a risky procedure to give him more storage space, the clock is ticking for Johnny to get the data out of his head before the data in his brain kills him. The narrative incorporates themes that explore balance between superior technology against superior humanity. And Guns. Well, one gun.

And we’ll be watching it, this time a little later in the month.

As usual, this event will be a watch-along , so we’ll not be providing the media, but we’d encourage you to obtain it via rental and share the links in the discourse or otherwise and join in the discussion as we watch on Twitter using the #InfoSecNI hashtag or on our Discord, where we might even do a voice chat if we can deal with the sync issues…

Meetup Link

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Virtual Event: InfoSecNI Watch-Along Movie Night - “Johnny Mnemonic” @ 7pm 22nd July!

item.title: Virtual Event: InfoSecNI Watch-Along Movie Night - “Ghost In The Shell” @ 7pm 22nd July!
item.dc:creator: bolster
item.description:
2020-08-22T18:00:00Z UTC → 2020-08-22T19:22:00Z UTC

Based on Masamune Shirows Manga series, the 1995 film my Kazunori Itō, follows Motoko Kusanagi, a cyborg public-security agent, who hunts a mysterious hacker known as the Puppet Master. The narrative incorporates philosophical themes that focus on self-identity in a technologically advanced world.

And we’ll be watching it, this time a little later in the month.

As usual, this event will be a watch-along , so we’ll not be providing the media, but we’d encourage you to obtain it via rental or otherwise and join in the discussion as we watch on Twitter using the #InfoSecNI hashtag or on our Discord, where we might even do a voice chat if we can deal with the sync issues…

  • Amazon Prime Video
  • iTunes Video

item.title: Password Night Event
item.dc:creator: art
item.description:
I’m doing a Password Night (Online) between 7:00pm and 8:30 pm on Thursday, 30th of July 2020. It’s an informal get together with people that are in the same boat that never find the time for this stuff.

Let’s take an hour to update old, bad, reused passwords to something better, and deactivate old accounts.

Join the Farset Labs Discord to participate.

Discord

Join the FarsetLabs Discord Server!

Check out the FarsetLabs community on Discord - hang out with 23 other members and enjoy free voice and text chat.

I’ve been creating internet accounts since I was in early teens and some of them are still “active”.

Time to time I remember them and think about that password I reused a bunch of times in 2010 and never changed.

A chance to take some time and think about security of your online accounts and learn ways to protect yourself.

Learning Resources

  • ';–have i been pwned?
  • NCSC Cyber Aware
  • NCSC Passwords
  • LastPass
  • Authy
  • Have You Been Pwned? - Computerphile
  • How to Choose a Password - Computerphile
  • Password Cracking - Computerphile
  • How Password Managers Work - Computerphile
  • 2FA: Two Factor Authentication - Computerphile
  • Diceware & Passwords - Computerphile

4 posts - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Password Night Event

item.title: CompTIA Security+ Certification Study Group 22nd July 2020!
item.dc:creator: ClaireB
item.description:
Hello everyone! We’re going to be testing the waters and seeing if there’s interest out there for Security Certification Study Groups, and we’ll be pioneering this with a study group dedicated to the first few chapters of the CompTIA Security+ study guide on Wednesday 22nd July at 6:30pm to 8pm (ish). We’ll be going through the chapters together and talking through difficult points, and doing the quizzes in the first 3 chapters of the book.

The study group will be held on our Discord server, make sure to join!

Don’t worry if you don’t have the study guide; come along anyway if you’re interested in this cert - the more the merrier!

We’ll be running additional study groups for other certs going forward too! Make sure to vote in the poll on our Discord, and make sure to vote here for the next study groups: Which Security Certs Are People Interested In Taking?

Make sure to register your interest here if you’ll be attending! :

Will you be attending the Sec+ Study Group?

Click to view the poll.

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: CompTIA Security+ Certification Study Group 22nd July 2020!

item.title: Virtual Event: InfoSecNI Watch-Along Movie Night - "Snowden" @ 7pm 11th July!
item.dc:creator: ClaireB
item.description:
Hello everyone! With the success and fun of our previous few community lockdown movie nights, we thought we’d host another one. This time, with a slightly more serious movie, we’ll be watching “Snowden”; the docu-drama about Edward Snowden, the famous whistleblower. This event will be a watch-along , so we’ll not be providing the media, but we’d encourage you to obtain it via rental or otherwise and join in the discussion as we watch on Twitter, Discourse and Keybase.

Our Twitter is here if you’d like to give us a follow: https://twitter.com/infosecni

And our Discord Server.

Available to rent on:

  • Apple iTunes Rental
  • Amazon Prime Video Rental

Any questions/comments, please either Tweet at us, DM us, or comment on this thread!

We’re ramping up to host more hardcore and educational cyber security themed events such as certification study groups! Make sure to check out our other polls for this, and of course come and say hello on our Discord server!

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Virtual Event: InfoSecNI Watch-Along Movie Night - "Snowden" @ 7pm 11th July!

item.title: Virtual Infrastructure: Azurised CTFd and Juiceshop for infrastructure-free collaborative hackery
item.dc:creator: bolster
item.description:
Last night, we had intended to do a ‘show and hack’, but we got distracted by infrastructure.

Virtual Meetup: Juicing the JuiceShop @ 6pm 20th May

So, instead, we used some spare Microsoft Azure credits that are donated to Farset Labs and lo and behold;

  1. The Hackable JuiceShop: https://infosecnijuiceshop.azurewebsites.net
  2. The Shared Scoreboard: https://infosecnictfd.azurewebsites.net

Scoreboard you say? Why yes! Now, this is in no means a competition and there will be no prizes, but with a longer term persistent progress, we can all drop in and out when it suits, see what we did last, and solve a ‘challenge’ over lunch without having to spin up any core infrastructure.

So sign up to the scoreboard and start hacking the JuiceShop.

If you want to play along with your own infrastructure, the CTF_KEY is infosecni_d34db33f, and check out here for instructions for how to update your images so your CTF ‘Flags’ match those generated by the scoreboard.

Happy Hacking!

2 posts - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Virtual Infrastructure: Azurised CTFd and Juiceshop for infrastructure-free collaborative hackery

item.title: Virtual Meetup: Juicing the JuiceShop @ 6pm 20th May
item.dc:creator: bolster
item.description:
After our first workshop session on secure VM operation, InfoSecNI is back again!

We’re all going to get together and hack the most insecure web application imaginable; Juice Shop.

It’s recommended that before attending you get set up with a local VM infrastructure (i.e. One snapshotted instance of the Juice Shop on your local machine set up, see instructions here).

We would also recommend reading through the first Part of the JuiceShop Guide

The meetup is going to be a peer-learning, collaborative ‘hack’, where we can show off things we got to work, and ask questions about things that didn’t work, or how these attacks can be prevented (or automated).

We’re currently choosing between a couple of conference options to best facilitate the collaborative nature of the event, but watch this space and we’ll let you know!

4 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Virtual Meetup: Juicing the JuiceShop @ 6pm 20th May

item.title: Virtual Meetup: Virtual Machine Crash Course
item.dc:creator: bolster
item.description:
2020-04-24T17:00:00Z UTC → 2020-04-24T18:30:00Z UTC

(Google Hangout / Streaming Link)

Learn how Virtual Machines work, and how to securely run VM’s for cybersecurity experimentation and research.

An online meetup and workshop run by @Tee, a local ‘Security Threat Exploit Researcher’.

In this session we’ll be building up towards running our own JuiceShop

After the main workshop, we’ll break into groups and play around with the JuiceShop in a collaborative manner.

A fantastic first event for anyone who ever wanted to explore Web Application Security but didn’t know where to start.

While you’re here, check out What this group is about, say hello and introduce yourself, and feel free to ask questions and discuss the event in this thread!

9 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Air Quality Sensor Workshop
item.dc:creator: bolster
item.description:
https://luftdaten.info/en/construction-manual/

Great workshop on particulate monitoring with ESP systems; minimal soldering required, but it’s missing two primary components (IMO);

Batteries and MQTT

From a ‘kitlist’, this could be part funded under the Open Data funding, meaning we could put on a subsidised workshop where people actually went away and installed their own sensors at home/work/whatever.

This thread is to keep track of progress/plans/ideas around this. And to shut slackbot up about reminding me to check in with @glenn

3 posts - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: Welcome, and what's the plan?
item.dc:creator: Angie
item.description:
InfoSecNI ’s aim is to foster a community of security students, amateurs and professionals who can learn from each other and ensure the sector is welcoming, supportive, and passing on skills. We aim to have transparent governance, and a tone of kindness and collaboration.

This is where we post meeting updates, and talk about any issues arising. You are welcome to comment!

25 posts - 5 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Welcome, and what's the plan?

item.title: About the Events category
item.dc:creator: bolster
item.description:
(Replace this first paragraph with a brief description of your new category. This guidance will appear in the category selection area, so try to keep it below 200 characters.)

Use the following paragraphs for a longer description, or to establish category guidelines or rules:

  • Why should people use this category? What is it for?

  • How exactly is this different than the other categories we already have?

  • What should topics in this category generally contain?

  • Do we need this category? Can we merge with another category, or subcategory?
